text: Hello. I'm having trouble associating a company with a custom object. I believe the issue is the associationType. I have the associationTypeId but I must be doing something wrong because all I get are various server errors. Does anyone have a working example that I can look at? (either Node or regular cURL)

Hello!
Would someone know how we should write python api calls to retrieve the calls ? I can’t find it in the documentation.
Thanks a lot! :woman-cartwheeling:
hi Line, have you seen the Demo Apps?

If I check the documentation, it shows like this:
```      'Authorization': `Bearer ${YOUR_TOKEN}`,
      'Content-Type': 'application/json'```

And in your code it looks like there is no seperation between authorization and bearer
``` "Authorization : Bearer XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",```
Not sure if that's the issue
What errors are you getting?

You can find more info here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

Hi Everyone! i have a question with the logs for the private app i working on, my issue is for ex is if i make a call like Post executed by a workflow of HubSpot, this log doesn`t appear in the private app logs, i eliminated all of the references of mi old api key and still work the script with my token private app! and i use a postman type program for make the GET/contacts  request and this log exist:disappointed_relieved:!

Hello there :slightly_smiling_face:
I just got a `500 internal error` while executing the following request `DELETE /automation/v2/workflows/:workflowId/enrollments/contacts/:email`

Is this endpoint still available and maintained?

Documentation found at: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/remove_contact>
What does it say on the API logs page?
Are you talking about a Postman call or a Custom Code call?

Well I got no extra details:
```{"status":"error","message":"internal error","correlationId":"8fc26891-075c-410b-8400-b3895b49d14b"}```
Are other API calls working?
Damn thanks for rubber ducking me, I was using the wrong workflow ids and the server did not prevent me
custom call on a php script
Anyway now it’s working, this endpoint seems to have no impact on enrollment list
Haha no worries! So is it working or not now?
If the call is not showing up in the API logs I would think the issue is in the PHP script. Mind sharing how you do the call?

Apparently it is :smiley: (got a 204 response) but I see no changes on HubSpot. Maybe I’m not using it the proper way.
I’m trying (as my other post on <#C019VT42R8X|workflows> explains) to unenroll a contact from the current workflow so that the contact can trigger multiple times the same workflow
I know I’m playing with HubSpot’s limitations and it’s not designed for that
I also tried the basic workflow setting “when a contact enroll this workflow => remove them from specific workflow” in vain
Based on what do you know the contact should be unenrolled?
You can maybe set a field and have an if/else based on that

So, if I understand correctly, you have a contact running through a workflow, and you want to make sure it doen't continue of something happens in your external service.
Then I would suggest the above approach
sure! this is the code
